docs.snippet: U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson on Sunday pressed the Trump administration's case for isolating and containing Iran in the Middle East and beyond as he pushed for Saudi Arabia and Iraq to unite in common cause to counter growing Iranian asse...

headline.main: US Pushes Saudi Arabia, Iraq on United Front to Counter Iran

headline.main: Tillerson's Mideast Aim Is a Saudi-Iraqi Axis Against Iran
headline.print_headline: Tillerson's Mideast Aim Is a Saudi-Iraqi Axis Against Iran

docs.snippet: U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson arrived in Riyadh on Saturday to attend a landmark meeting between officials from Saudi Arabia and Iraq aimed at improving relations between the two countries and countering Iran’s growing regional influ...

headline.main: Tillerson Lands in Riyadh at Start of Gulf, South Asia Tour

docs.snippet: Qatar's diplomatic crisis is holding up the sale of a shipping company it part owns, one of the latest signs of an emerging corporate fall-out that Doha is facing after Arab countries cut relations in June, sources familiar with the matter said....

headline.main: Exclusive-Qatar Diplomatic Crisis Delays Sale of Gulf Shipping Firm, Sources Say
headline.print_headline: Exclusive-Qatar Diplomatic Crisis Delays Sale of Gulf Shipping Firm, Sources Say

docs.snippet: Secretary of State Rex Tillerson heads to the Middle East, South Asia and Europe this week on a diplomatic mission focused on conflicts in Iraq and Syria and blunting Iranian influence in the region, the State Department said Thursday.

headline.main: Tillerson Off to Mideast, South Asia With Eye on Iran, Iraq
headline.print_headline: Tillerson Off to Mideast, South Asia With Eye on Iran, Iraq

docs.snippet: Qatar is "open to dialogue" in resolving a dispute that has seen the Gulf state isolated from its Arab neighbors, its emir said during a visit to Indonesia on Wednesday.

headline.main: Qatar Emir Says Open to Dialogue to Resolve Gulf Crisis
headline.print_headline: Qatar Emir Says Open to Dialogue to Resolve Gulf Crisis

docs.snippet: A Qatar-hosted football tournament for Arab nations should not go ahead unless Kuwait's FIFA ban is lifted, the UAE Football Association's president said on Tuesday, denying that his country's boycott was related to the crisis between Gulf states.

headline.main: Qatar Gulf Cup Boycott Is Over Kuwait's FIFA Ban, UAE FA Says
headline.print_headline: Qatar Gulf Cup Boycott Is Over Kuwait's FIFA Ban, UAE FA Says

docs.snippet: Medics who rushed to help victims of a huge bomb explosion in the Somali capital Mogadishu that killed more than 300 people say the country's threadbare emergency services have been pushed beyond their limit.

headline.main: Chaotic Response to Somali Bombing Cost Lives, Medics Say
headline.print_headline: Chaotic Response to Somali Bombing Cost Lives, Medics Say

docs.snippet: With an isolated leader, a demoralized diplomatic corps and a president dismantling international relations one tweet at a time, American foreign policy is adrift in the world.

headline.main: Rex Tillerson and the Unraveling of the State Department

docs.snippet: Malaysia on Monday rolled out the red carpet for Qatar's emir, who is on his first trip to Southeast Asia four months after a diplomatic crisis erupted between his nation and four Arab countries.

headline.main: Malaysia Rolls Out Red Carpet for Qatar's Emir
headline.print_headline: Malaysia Rolls Out Red Carpet for Qatar's Emir
